text:
Hi all, sorry if this isn’t the right place but I’ve seen talk about restricted content here so here goes :

I’m currently setting up a new blog for documentation on our Product. In certain articles, I would like to restrict sections of content so that only members that log in will be able to view this.
Yet so far from what I understood of the HubSpot Documentation (<https://knowledge.HubSpot.com/website-pages/require-member-registration-to-access-private-content>) I can only restrict an entire blog and not just a specific article, much less a section of said article.

Is there a way to set this up in HubSpot or would I be best served trying to make my own mechanic?

Sounds like what you want to do is use smart content. The blog itself may not be the best place for that content if that’s the aim unless the structure of the content is consistent across all of the documentation pages (you would use a module for this).

The jist though is you’d use smart content to display certain content based on list membership
<https://knowledge.HubSpot.com/website-pages/create-and-manage-smart-content-rules>
